p: Our study region is Oregon in the Pacific Northwest, where coastal and montane forests have high biomass and carbon sequestration potential. They represent coastal forests from northern California to southeast Alaska, where trees live 800 y or more and biomass can exceed that of tropical forests ( 11) ( Fig. S1). The semiarid ecoregions consist of woodlands that experience frequent fires ( 12). Land-use history is a major determinant of forest carbon balance. Harvest was the dominant cause of tree mortality (2003â€“2012) and accounted for fivefold as much mortality as that from fire and beetles combined ( 13). Forest land ownership is predominantly public (64%), and 76% of the biomass harvested is on private lands.
